intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to export the Eclipse Browser plug-in as an RCP application.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Create the product configuration
item.description: To create the product configuration, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Product Configuration" from the main menu
Select "org.eclipsecon.browser" in the resulting "New Product Configuration" wizard page
Input "browser.product" into the "File name" text box
Select the "Use a launch configuration" radio button inside the "Initialize the file content" group and click "Finish".

item.title: Open the product editor
item.description:
To open the product editor (if it is not already open), expand the org.eclipsecon.browser tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the browser.product file (the Overview page should be open initially).
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Define the product
item.description: To define the product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Input "Browser RCP Application" into the "Product Name" text box
Click the "New..." button next to the "Product ID" drop down menu to open the "New Product Definition" dialog box
Verify "org.eclipsecon.browser" is the inputted value for the "Defining Plug-in" text box
Verify "product" is the inputted value for the "Product ID" text box
Select "org.eclipsecon.browser.application" in the "Application" combo.
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Synchronize the product configuration with the defining plug-in
item.description:
Product configurations and their constituent files may become unsynchronized. This situation is apparent when changes made using the product editor are not reflected in the application.
To synchronize the product configuration with the defining plug-in, click the Synchronize hyperlink under the Testing heading on the product editor Overview page.
Note: PDE automatically synchronizes the product configuration when the Launch the product hyperlinks under the Testing heading are used.

item.title: Run the RCP product
item.description: To run the RCP product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Click the "Launch the product" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Note: "Browser RCP Application" now shows up in the window title bar
Exit the RCP application

item.title: Open the build configuration editor
item.description:
To open the build configuration editor, expand the org.eclipsecon.browser tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the build.properties file.
Select the Build tab to display the Build Configuration page if it is not the initial page.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Modify the build configuration
item.description:
In order to control what files are deployed with our packaged RCP application, we need to modify the build configuration.
To modify the build configuration, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the checkbox corresponding to the "data" directory under the "Binary Build" heading
Select the checkbox corresponding to the "icons" directory under the "Binary Build" heading
Select the checkbox corresponding to the "schema" directory under the "Binary Build" heading
Select the checkbox corresponding to the "plugin.properties" file under the "Binary Build" heading
Select the checkbox corresponding to the "splash.bmp" file under the "Binary Build" heading
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Open the product editor
item.description:
To open the product editor (if it is not already open), expand the org.eclipsecon.browser tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the browser.product file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Add window images
item.description: To add window images, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Branding" tab within the product editor to display the "Branding" page
Click the "Browse" button adjacent to the "16x16" text box under the "Window Images" heading
Fully expand the "org.eclipsecon.browser" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_window_16.gif" and click "OK"
Click the "Browse" button adjacent to the "32x32" text box under the "Window Images" heading
Fully expand the "org.eclipsecon.browser" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_window_32.gif" and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Customize the launcher
item.description:
We will walk through this task assuming we are working on a Windows platform (Similar steps may be followed for other platforms).
To customize the launcher, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Launcher" tab within the product editor to display the "Launcher" page
Input "browser" into the "Launcher Name" text box under the "Program Launcher" heading
Select the "win32" tab under the "Program Launcher" heading
Select the "Use a single ICO file containing 7 images as specified above" radio button
Click the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "File" text box
Fully expand the "org.eclipsecon.browser" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_launcher.ico" and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Export the plug-in based product
item.description: To export the plug-in based product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab within the product editor to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Eclipse Product export wizard" hyperlink under the "Exporting" heading to launch the "Export" dialog box
Verify that "/org.eclipsecon.browser/browser.product" is entered in the "Configuration" combo box within the "Product Configuration" group
Input "browser_rcpapp" in the "Root directory" text box contained in the "Product Configuration" group
Input a destination directory in the "Directory" text box under the "Destination" group (e.g. "C:\" for Windows) and click "Finish"

item.title: Browse the exported plug-in based product directory
item.description: To browse the exported plug-in based product directory, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Navigate your file system to the destination directory specified in the previous step (e.g. "C:\" for Windows)
Note the presence of the "rcpapp_plugin-based" directory in the destination directory and open it
Note the presence of the "org.eclipsecon.browser" plug-in along with many other RCP plug-ins it depends upon within the "plugins" sub-directory
Note the "browser" launcher with a branded icon ("browser.exe" on Windows)
Run the "browser" launcher
Observe the plug-in based RCP application you created that is fully executable outside the Eclipse workspace
Exit the RCP application
